cabra
Class ProjectPanel

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  cabra.ProjectPanel
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class ProjectPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel

A project's panel. This is found in the ProjectListPanel to the left. Each project gets one of these.

Author:
Neel
See Also:
Serialized Form

Method Detail

projectEquals

public boolean projectEquals(Project other)
Returns whether this panel's project is the same as the given project.

Parameters:
other - the project to compare against
Returns:
true if they're the same, false otherwise

refresh

public void refresh()
Updates the project name label to match the actual project name.

buildPanel

private void buildPanel()
Builds the panel, which will include project name and buttons with ops.

showPopupMenu

private void showPopupMenu(java.awt.event.MouseEvent event)
Shows a menu that "pops up" on top of this panel. It contains items that let the user edit the project, delete it, etc. Only call this when 1) the project has been clicked and 2) the click was supposed to trigger a popup menu (right-click).

Parameters:
event - the MouseEvent created when the click was fired. The Listener should provide this.
